roleset.name: to prepare a meal or treat by heating, completely heated, as a prepared meal
roleset.note: COOK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cook' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from cook.01-v predicate notes)
COOKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry cook.01. Corresponds to VN classes 26.1, 26.3-1, 45.3. (from cooking.01-n)
COOKED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from cooked.01-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [Twenty-five trucks]-1 capable of [*]-1 cooking food were dispatched [*-1] from other states .

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: ...and I-1 had PRO-1 to like clean the house and do the cooking and watch Sam

example.name: All Arguments
example.text: Brand new test cook Kim sent over a report on her cooking of the shrimp dish.

example.name: arg1, metaphorical extension
example.text: His career is over. Yeah he s cooked

roleset.name: to happen, take place
roleset.note: COOK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cook' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from cook.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Aer Rianta is talking about similar joint ventures in Tashkent and in Sochi , a Black Sea resort , and even has a computer-assembly project cooking with the Georgian city of Tbilisi .
example.arg: with the Georgian city of Tbilisi

example.name: passive
example.text: Clearly , [a new rationale for national service]-1 had [*-1]to be cooked up .
